Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the cost of the stimulus program by stating that it cost $278,000 per job created, which is not supported by the White House report.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the $278,000 per job figure does not appear in the White House report or any other official source.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the sole purpose of the stimulus program was to create and save jobs, ignoring other investments and benefits it provided.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the stimulus program also aimed to invest in American infrastructure, education, and industries like clean energy.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the cost of the stimulus program, such as the various components and investments it included.
